headline: Chicken Enchiladas with Flour Tortillas
description: These chicken enchiladas with flour tortillas are a kid-favorite dish that is cheesy, super satisfying, and a great way to use up leftover chicken.
name: Chicken Enchiladas with Flour Tortillas
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1.5 cups cubed cooked chicken breast meat

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a large baking dish.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Sauté green onions in hot butter until tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic powder, then stir in condensed soup, green chiles, and sour cream. Mix sauce until well combined. Reserve 3/4 of the sauce in a bowl and set aside. Add chicken and 1/2 cup cheese to remaining sauce in the pan; stir until cheese is melted.
Fill each flour tortilla with chicken mixture and roll up. Place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
Stir milk into reserved sauce in the bowl and spoon over rolled tortillas. Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is bubbly, 30 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a recipe for chicken enchiladas on a cold winter’s day for what I had in the house so I wouldn’t have to go out to the store. I had exactly what this called for, I made it thinking it wouldn’t exactly be what my husband was thinking of—no red sauce. He flipped out over how good it was. It had all stuff I like so I knew I would like it. It’s a keeper.

This recipe is really bland. The corn tortillas made it even worse and they didn't even hold up all that well as reviewers said. I see a lot reviews modifying the recipe but I'm here for a recipe I can cook not to read comments. People are rating this 5 stars after modifying the recipe. It's not a 5 star recipe if you have to heavily modify it.
Prepared as the recipe stated. It was delicious!
I doubled the sauce. Delicious recipe! I will definitely be making this again! So easy!

Delicious but this only yielded 3 for me and I see that-someone else said the same thing recently. I guess if you stuff them less you could get 6 but they'd be sad and empty. I precooked the chicken using some taco spices. I did make two changes to the original recipe: first, I used cream of chicken instead of cream of mushroom, as per previous review suggestions. And then I used almond milk instead of regular milk - doesn't make a difference to the taste of the sauce at all. Overall they're very very good, but I wonder what they would taste like using corn tortillas instead - the flour tortillas get a bit mushy and just taste a bit floury. So for that I give it 4*! Everything else is top notch.
I've been making this for years and it's a family favorite. I end up making 2 pans, doubling the chicken and quadrupling the sauce.
Only made three but turned out great.
Very good enchiladas. I heated tortillas in oil for 3 sec each side. Then coated each side in sauce then wrapped.
Good recipe, but do yourself a favor and use corn tortillas. The flour ones get soggy and do not hold up like corn.
A family favorite. I've been making this for many years. My little girl is now an adult. So that's how long. The only difference is that I use fresh onions, garlic, and hatch green chilies.
My family loved this. I also added tomatoes to it and it was great!

I made this for my family last night and everyone loved it. I made two dishes, 1 with GF tortillas and the other 1 with regular flour. I doubled the sauce (1 can GF cream of mushroom and 1 can GF cream of chicken) and added some diced red peppers. I added some chili powder and cumin but will add more next time because my daughter was saying it tasted sweet, which could’ve been the GF tortillas. I served with mexican rice and salad. Delicious!
It was good, but cubed chicken didn’t go well. Will shred next time.

I followed the recipe and made no deviations. The enchiladas are good. However, I do see why some people double the chicken and sauce. The flavors came together really well, but there just wasn't enough filling for such large tortillas.
I love it. Was very easy and family loved it too. Tsk for the recipe.
I’m making this by request for the second time in 3 weeks. My picky, 12 year olds daughter loves it!

My boyfriend asked for enchiladas and they turned out yummy, and he loved them! I used mushroom soup instead and I cooked the chicken in taco seasoning but the rest of the recipe I kept as is! And I must say next day they where almost even better!

Giving this recipe 4 stars. Slightly bland as is, but so versatile and fun to make. You can add all sorts of different stuff to the sauce to change it up, like salsa, extra veggies, etc. It definitely has become a family favorite and I love that even if I don't have every ingredient on hand, it's still doable. For example, I just made this a few mins ago, but didn't have any sour cream so I added a little rue w/ some broth, milk, butter, and flour to thicken it up and it gave it that nice creamy texture. Definitely worth making!
We love to put chicken flavored rice in it to make the recipe go further!

This sounded delicious when I read the recipe. I was disappointed in the final result. The only thing that reminded me of enchilada was the tortilla. On the other hand, i gave some to a friend, and they raved about them. If i was to do it again, i would spice them up somehow.
I followed the recipe and loved it! Very good!
Delicious, quick and easy! Very satisfying.

Great base! The mushroom soup was a great addition to make the chicken creamy. I did not use milk. I also kept the sauce together rather than leaving some aside. I used green enchilada sauce to wet the tortillas instead. I added chili powder, fresh garlic, pepper and cayenne pepper to the sauce to add a zing to the chicken. Rotisserie chicken works well for simplification and speediness of the recipe. Add a simple green salad with a balsamic dressing as a side. It accompanies the dish quite well.

First, I agree with other Enchilada Purists that these aren't enchiladas without corn tortillas. Still, I decided to try this recipe and found it all very bland. I had to keep adding spices and finally gave up and opened a can of green enchilada sauce. I mixed in some of the soup mixture with the enchilada sauce. It was ok, but nothing I would make again.

I made it gluten free with gf tortillas that got pan fried in butter before filling. We favor extra cheese in our dishes too, so... I added a scoop of the following mixture along with the meat mix: blend of ricotta, sour cream, Mexican cheese mix, and taco seasoning. Really tasty, rich dish.
Very fast to make and tastes good. I am not a fan of using flour tortillas for enchiladas. Next time I will make with corn tortillas. I used rotisserie chicken which helps speed up prep time.

This is pretty good! Super simple, limited cleanup. It's not what I would call enchiladas, tho. Maybe Creamy Chicken Tortilla Bake. But it tastes great. I recommend spooning some of the sauce on the bottom of the pan to keep the bottoms of the tortillas from getting hard. I used half flour and half corn tortillas, either works. I added some chicken bullion and hot sauce to the filling, but other than that, I followed the recipe. Thanks for sharing it!
Super easy and tasty recipe. I add a can of black beans and corn to give it more substance (you could even . Other than that, no changes.
I added petite tomatoes and black beans which made it much better. I also doubled the recipe.

I made this tonight. Both the kids and I loved it. Only thing different is I used corn tortillas because that's what I had on hand. I would've used flour had they been in house. I will be making this again. my kids demolished the entire pan.
Easy to make and hubby liked it, that's a plus. Used salsa instead of green chilies. Definitely a make again.
Made it as written and we enjoyed it. Will make again.

This was delish! My hubby doesn't like tomatoes so this worked very well. Couple of mods I made: used evaporated milk vice regular milk, no cream of mushroom soup instead added alittle more evaporated milk and jalapeños vice green chiles and regular onion. Agree with other person that corn holds up better than flour tortillas. Flour tortillas get gummy but with this recipe, it is not too noticeable because of the cream sauce on top. Definitely will do this one again! Next time I will try with corn tortillas. yummy recipe!
I was a little skeptical but this was amazing and super easy to make!

I would give it a 5 but I made changes as I read reviews. I added taco seasoning to my shredded chicken and used corn tortillas! Will double the sauce next time because I like enchilada sauce with my enchiladas! Overall a good recipe!

This recipe is Midwestern casserole meets TexMex, and I mean that in a pretty good way. It's definitely one of those whole family approved recipes. It's pretty good as-is, but if you're used to your "Mexican" food having a little kick to it, you will need to add some chili powder and Cayenne pepper. I tasted it right after I had mixed all the ingredients together, and it just tasted way too "casserole" for me. I added a big dash of chili power and a smaller dash of Cayenne, and it was perfect. My whole family liked it! I only got 4 big enchiladas out of this recipe, not 6, but my kids only ate half of one.
Instead of using milk I used heavy cream. Next time I'll add more heavy cream to make more sauce to put over it. It was delicious and my family loved it
Made exactly as noted. These were delicious.
These were alright but needed more of the sauce mixture.

O.M.G. I only made 2 changes. I sautéed the shredded chicken in taco seasoning and I used cream of chicken instead of cream of mushroom. Other than that, followed recipe exactly. Everyone LOVED it. So good.
I didn't have a can of green chilis so I used a full can of Rotel. I also used a block of cream cheese in place of the sour cream.
Cooked chicken in medium salsa then shredded it.

My family loved this! I followed some reviewer's recommendations and doubled it, which was great because we had leftovers. The flavor was really good. I also used one cream of chicken can instead of the second cream of mushroom when I doubled it. The only thing I thought was that the sauce seemed a little thick, so next time I will add more milk to give a creamy, runnier consistency, but that is just my personal preference. I also made one with Ezekiel tortilla for my husband (who is trying to minimize carbs) and he said it was great! Have added it to my regular main dishes.
Quarantine cooking so I swapped cream of mushroom for cream of chicken and leeks for green onions. Delicious.
i am not a fan of mushrooms, so I used cream of chicken instead, and it was so delicious!
Easy to make and great tasting!
Easy and pretty quick. I'm not a fan of red sauce taste. Substitute in cream of chicken instead and today I chopped up Spinach in the mixture and added to top.
Easy to make and a great way to use left over beer can chicken. I added a can of cream of chicken soup and an extra cup of shredded chicken to the recipe.
great for a change of pace from beef enchiladas and easy to make.
I have made this a few times now and my family loves it. I have doubled the sauce because we like extra sauce.
It was great tasting and enjoyable to make. I made some changes based on what I had in my fridge and pantry. Everything worked beautifully. There were absolutely no leftovers.
Excellent recipe! Delicious and easy.
The whole family loved them and I loved the sauce!
This recipe was easy and well worth the time to make. I used leftover chicken that had been smoked on the grill and added some fresh spinach to the mix. Very good.
would've liked little more sacuce
would've liked little more sacuce
Great, although need to double the sauce.
These are OK tasting but hardly qualify as an enchilada. The only Mexican tasting ingredient is the green chiles. They should be called "creamy chicken roll ups".
came out amazing. I didn't use green onions because I didn't have them. I used cream of chicken. Added garlic.
This recipe is great. I made it just like the recipe except I didn't have green onions, so just used diced yellow onions. The green olives too this recipe to a high level of great!
this is a good recipe. I added a little salsa to the sauce and it turned out very tasty. will make again!
I used smaller tortillas and Vidalia onions since that's what I had on hand during self isolation. Easy to put together.

I don’t usually review recipes because I tend to make changes to things so that it suits what I like. But!! This one is so good as is! I made it the first time exactly as written (okay I lied a bit, ran out of garlic powder so minced a clove and sauted it with the green onions), and it was so so so good. I’ve made it three times since then, and the only change I regularly make is I add about a tablespoon of packaged fajita seasoning when cooking the chicken, but without it it’s still good! If you make it you absolutely don’t need to make changes at all, but it’s also so versatile you could add extra spices or veggies or make it more spicy, etc. Love it!
Awesome!!!

I really enjoyed this recipe! I used it as a base and modified as a few other commenters suggested.

* Using corn tortillas (dipped in hot oil for 2-3 seconds before filling)
* Adding cilantro 
* Doubling cream of mushroom soup 
* Using more cheese 
* Using fresh serrano peppers 

Served with rice & fresh corn. Great for dinner on a warm spring day.
I made this exactly as written and my husband loved it! I will use flour shells and not corn next time. The corn is what we had on hand.
I really liked this recipe! It was very easy to make, as I have not cooked much before! Thanks for the recipe! It was delicious :)
Loved it

I have been using this recipe for years. I have followed the recipe exactly, and am constantly requested to make them for different gatherings. Cheat: use a rotisserie chicken from you local grocery store. It saves time and guarantees will be cooked to perfection. Can't tell the difference PROMISE

I have been using this recipe for years. I have followed the recipe exactly, and am constantly requested to make them for different gatherings. Cheat: use a rotisserie chicken from you local grocery store. It saves time and guarantees will be cooked to perfection. Can't tell the difference PROMISE
We loved it! Just enough hotness and very tasty!
This recipe is a great use for your leftover chicken. It has a wonderful flavor and is easy to put together. Everyone enjoyed it.
I added some beans and rice. Could have still used a little more kick. I would add a few more chilies next time! Delicious tho
Easy and tasty. I used corn tortillas though.
Sooooo delicious and easy- definitely a keeper! I did add a little cayenne and cumin to the sauce.
It was delicious and I will be making it again.

These were very good. They are not mind blowing mexican food but for an easy weekday dinner these hit the spot. You have enough sauce but a little extra would be nice. I might double the batch next time. Also put a small amount of the sauce on the bottom of your pain before adding your rolled enchiladas. otherwise the flour tortillas will harden on the bottom. I put a 7 oz can of green chiles and they still had little to no spice. If you like spicy you'll have to add your own favorites to kick it up a notch!

Very good, but I substituted vegan "chicken" pieces to make it kosher. 

I also added cumin, and thinly sliced mushrooms (I didn't use the mushroom soup, I used heavy cream instead).

This recipe is a bit underwhelming to me. I don't hate it, but I don't love it. I followed it as written. I like the sauce. It would be good on chicken breasts. I agree with those who said it tastes like a chicken casserole.

Quite good and would definitely make again. Only mods were:

* Used ~3/4 cup green onion (3 green onions)
* Used shredded chicken from Instant pot (1.2 pounds - ~2 cups)
* Used small corn tortillas (6 inch) and yielded 13 enchiladas

Thoughts on future mods would be to sub the can of green chiles with fresh chopped jalapeno and/or red/green peppers.
My family loves this recipie and I haven't made any changes, we like it just as it is. It has become a favorite go to.
My family loves this dish. Any thoughts on preparing this the day before? I would like to serve this at party.
I Love this recipe! Made it exactly like it is written, as I always do first, then adjust if needed. No adjustments are needed for us. I even make this chicken filling for chili rellenos.

Fantastic recipe and very tasty outcome!! I didn't alter the recipe at all and everyone loved it. It was our Christmas dinner main dish. I enjoyed making it and especially enjoyed everyone eating it. Thank you!

My family is pretty picky, so we ate around the mushrooms and green chiles. Didn't have any green onion, but like I said--picky. It didn't really make more than 4 enchiladas though, and I had smaller tortillas. Still delicious!

Im just really confused on the number of ratings ranking this dish so highly. I do not like leaving a bad review, but good or bad it can maybe give others insight. When I started making this I was feeling proud that I was preparing a new well reviewed meal for my family, even the “sauce” seemed to be creamy and a delicious starting point...however when it came down to the filling there was not enough to properly fill the tortillas. The sauce was super salty and tasted very canned and you might as well eat cream of mushroom straight from the can that’s your thing or dip a warm tortilla in a can of cream of mushroom and eat it that way. I cook prep-heavy meals almost every day and am big into cooking. This was terrible and I will not be making it again.
This was great. Easy to prep,and common foods from the cupboard.

This is great comfort food. Easy to prepare. I chose to try to lessen the amount of fat in the recipe by using fat free sour cream and low fat cream of chicken soup instead of cream of mushroom. Tasted great, nothing was missing. I paired it with some spanish rice and refried beans as side dishes.
This was so easy to make, and everyone loved it! Definitely would make it again. I would recommend adding some extra filling such as beans, or peppers, but overall it tastes just fine as it is.
I followed the recipe, I did use corn tortillas, bad choice, they're impossible to roll. I used to bug a baking dish. They taste amazing

Our dinner guests all loved it. I followed the recipe except that I doubled everything for a party of 10. 

Also, I used homemade plain greek yogurt in place of sour cream. I pressure cooked boneless, skinless chicken breast and shredded it instead of cubes and I used the popular suggestion of white corn tortillas. I will make this again!

We made this tonight for dinner. I used shredded chicken that I made in a slow cooker but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I'm honestly surprised at how good it is using canned cream of mushroom soup. In the past I've made the sauce from scratch but I wanted a shortcut this time. Next time we might use a 7oz can of green chiles but the recipe is really good as written.
These are good. I umakeit just like the recipe, however the last time I made them I doubled the recipe and added 1 can of jalapeño refried beans and it made for a delicious flavor and texture.
This is a mild recipe. Probably why so many have enhanced. Found the ratio of filling was not sufficient. Bake time was accurate.
Superb!
Tastes great for the minimal effort and little time it takes.

I have made this recipe several times and we absolutely love it. Today, however, when I reached into my freezer for what I thought was chicken breast, what I came out with was ground turkey breast. Not being one to back down from a challenge, I sautéed the turkey with a little bit of taco seasoning. This was unbelievably good. La familia says they want me to make it this way always. And I will.
Good way to use up leftover chicken. Next time want to try cream of chicken soup.

I did make a few changes. Like everyone seemed to be suggesting, I doubled the sauce, and I'm glad that I did. 
I didn't have enough cheddar, but used the Walmart brand Fiesta Blend. 
I used 2 cans (10oz each) of Rotel Original, tomatoes and green chilies. 
And I added some Herdez Salsa Verde to the mix. 
And I used shredded chicken, instead of cubed. 
Turned out great. Would definitely make again.
